snippet: Tacitly acknowledging the current structure is rife with conflicts, Thomas Bach ordered a complete rethinking of it on Tuesday.
abstract: International Olympic Committee president Thomas Bach concedes need for antidoping agency that is cordoned off from governments and sports organizations that fund it; implies potential conflicts of interest in current system discourage serious investigations and risk compromising integrity of sports.
lead_paragraph: Tacitly acknowledging the current structure is rife with conflicts, Thomas Bach ordered a complete rethinking of it on Tuesday.

headline.main: After Russian Ban, I.O.C. President Addresses Antidoping Efforts
headline.print_headline: I.O.C. Chief Seeks to Fix Antidoping ‘Deficiencies’
